definition: to be wounded/to sustain an injury
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)

sentences.english: There was a serious train accident near the border. Two people were killed and twelve were injured.
sentences.chinese: 疆域发生紧张列车变乱，二人灭亡，十二人负伤。

sentences.english: The State regulation shall apply during Employee's sick leave and medical treatment period.
sentences.chinese: 乙方患病或非因工负伤的医疗期限，按国家规定确定。

sentences.english: For many athletes, playing through injuries is standard practice.
sentences.chinese: 对很多运动员而言，负伤上阵是标准的做法。

sentences.english: The soldier was invalided home because of the wounds he received.
sentences.chinese: 这位战士因负伤而被遣送回家。

sentences.english: Wounded haze it running in the woods, the day a group of soldiers followed behind.
sentences.chinese: 负伤的岚么在树林中奔跑，身后一群日兵紧追不舍。
还有成千上万的军人负伤归来。

sentences.english: Some of them had already ee injured ome of them had ee a friend get hurt.
sentences.chinese: 他们中的一些已经负伤，一些人眼见朋友受伤。

definition: to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
to go to war/to engage in war
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
to die in the line of duty
to fight with all one's might
to meet violent death/to get killed
